content:
ResXDataNode Class

In this Article

Represents an element in an XML resource (.resx) file.

Syntax

Declaration

public sealed class ResXDataNode : System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • ResXDataNode

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Remarks

The ResXDataNode class supports the representation of rich data types within a resource file. It can support the storage of any object in a resource file, so long as the object supports serialization and type editors.

You can create a ResXDataNode object by calling one of its overloaded class constructors. You can then add the resource item or element to a resource file by calling the AddResource method.

To retrieve an existing ResXDataNode object, you must enumerate the ResXDataNode objects in an XML resource file by instantiating a ResXResourceReader object, setting the UseResXDataNodes property to true, and calling the GetEnumerator method to get an enumerator. The example provides an illustration.

Constructors summary

ResXDataNode(String,Object)

Initializes a new instance of the ResXDataNode class.
ResXDataNode(String,ResXFileRef)

Initializes a new instance of the ResXDataNode class with a reference to a resource file.
ResXDataNode(String,Object,Func<Type,String>)

Initializes a new instance of the ResXDataNode class.
ResXDataNode(String,ResXFileRef,Func<Type,String>)

Initializes a new instance of the ResXDataNode class with a reference to a resource file.

Properties summary

Comment

Gets or sets an arbitrary comment regarding this resource.
FileRef

Gets the file reference for this resource.
Name

Gets or sets the name of this resource.

Methods summary

GetNodePosition()

Retrieves the position of the resource in the resource file.
GetValue(ITypeResolutionService)

Retrieves the object that is stored by this node by using the specified type resolution service.
GetValue(AssemblyName[])

Retrieves the object that is stored by this node by searching the specified assemblies.
GetValueTypeName(ITypeResolutionService)

Retrieves the type name for the value by using the specified type resolution service.
GetValueTypeName(AssemblyName[])

Retrieves the type name for the value by examining the specified assemblies.

Explicit Interface Implementations summary

ISerializable.GetObjectData(SerializationInfo,StreamingContext)

Populates a SerializationInfo object with the data needed to serialize the target object.

Constructors

  • ResXDataNode(String,Object)

    Initializes a new instance of the ResXDataNode class.

    public ResXDataNode (string name, object value);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The name of the resource.

    • value
      System.Object

      The resource to store.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The resource named in value does not support serialization.

    • ArgumentNullException

      name is null.

    • ArgumentException

      name is a string of zero length.

  • ResXDataNode(String,ResXFileRef)

    Initializes a new instance of the ResXDataNode class with a reference to a resource file.

    public ResXDataNode (string name, System.Resources.ResXFileRef fileRef);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The name of the resource.

    • fileRef
      ResXFileRef

      The file reference to use as the resource.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      name is null or fileRef is null.

    • ArgumentException

      name is a string of zero length.

  • ResXDataNode(String,Object,Func<Type,String>)

    Initializes a new instance of the ResXDataNode class.

    public ResXDataNode (string name, object value, Func<Type,string> typeNameConverter);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The name of the resource.

    • value
      System.Object

      The resource to store.

    • typeNameConverter
      Func<Type,String>

      A reference to a method that takes a Type and returns a string containing the Type name.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The resource named in value does not support serialization.

    • ArgumentNullException

      name is null.

    • ArgumentException

      name is a string of zero length.

  • ResXDataNode(String,ResXFileRef,Func<Type,String>)

    Initializes a new instance of the ResXDataNode class with a reference to a resource file.

    public ResXDataNode (string name, System.Resources.ResXFileRef fileRef, Func<Type,string> typeNameConverter);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The name of the resource.

    • fileRef
      ResXFileRef

      The file reference to use as the resource.

    • typeNameConverter
      Func<Type,String>

      A reference to a method that takes a Type and returns a string containing the Type name.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      name is null or fileRef is null.

    • ArgumentException

      name is a string of zero length.

Properties

  • Comment

    Gets or sets an arbitrary comment regarding this resource.

    public string Comment { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A string that represents the comment.

    Remarks

    If a comment has not been assigned to the resource item, the value of the Comment property is System.String.

    You access the Comment property of an data node in an existing XML resource file by instantiating a ResXResourceReader object, setting the UseResXDataNodes property to true, and calling the GetEnumerator method to retrieve an IDictionaryEnumerator object that you use to enumerate the items in the XML resource file. The Value property returns the ResXDataNode object.

    Example

    See the example for the ResXDataNode class.

  • FileRef

    Gets the file reference for this resource.

    public System.Resources.ResXFileRef FileRef { get; }

    Property Value

    • ResXFileRef

      The file reference, if this resource uses one. If this resource stores its value as an Object, this property will return null.

  • Name

    Gets or sets the name of this resource.

    public string Name { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A string that corresponds to the resource name. If no name is assigned, this property returns a zero-length string.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      The name property is set to null.

    • ArgumentException

      The name property is set to a string of zero length.

Methods

  • GetNodePosition()

    Retrieves the position of the resource in the resource file.

    public System.Drawing.Point GetNodePosition ();

    Returns

    • Point

      A structure that specifies the location of this resource in the resource file as a line position (stem.Drawing.Point.X*) and a column position (stem.Drawing.Point.Y*). If this resource is not part of a resource file, this method returns a structure that has an stem.Drawing.Point.X* of 0 and a stem.Drawing.Point.Y* of 0.

  • GetValue(ITypeResolutionService)

    Retrieves the object that is stored by this node by using the specified type resolution service.

    public object GetValue (System.ComponentModel.Design.ITypeResolutionService typeResolver);

    Parameters

    • typeResolver
      ITypeResolutionService

      The type resolution service to use when looking for a type converter.

    Returns

    • System.Object

      The object that corresponds to the stored value.

    Exceptions

    • TypeLoadException

      The corresponding type could not be found, or an appropriate type converter is not available.

    Remarks

    If the stored value currently exists in memory, it is returned directly. If it is stored in the resource file and it is not a file reference, GetValue looks for a TypeConverter by using the specified type resolution service that can convert from a string to the appropriate object. If the resource is a file reference, GetValue tries to de-serialize it.

  • GetValue(AssemblyName[])

    Retrieves the object that is stored by this node by searching the specified assemblies.

    public object GetValue (System.Reflection.AssemblyName[] names);

    Parameters

    • names
      AssemblyName[]

      The list of assemblies to search for the type of the object.

    Returns

    • System.Object

      The object that corresponds to the stored value.

    Exceptions

    • TypeLoadException

      The corresponding type could not be found, or an appropriate type converter is not available.

    Remarks

    If the stored value currently exists in memory, it is returned directly. If it is stored in the resource file and it is not a file reference, GetValue looks in the assemblies identified by names to find the object's corresponding type, and then looks for a TypeConverter that can convert from a string to the appropriate object. If the resource is a file reference, GetValue tries to deserialize it.

  • GetValueTypeName(ITypeResolutionService)

    Retrieves the type name for the value by using the specified type resolution service.

    public string GetValueTypeName (System.ComponentModel.Design.ITypeResolutionService typeResolver);

    Parameters

    • typeResolver
      ITypeResolutionService

      The type resolution service to use to locate a converter for this type.

    Returns

    • String

      A string that represents the fully qualified name of the type.

    Exceptions

    • TypeLoadException

      The corresponding type could not be found.

  • GetValueTypeName(AssemblyName[])

    Retrieves the type name for the value by examining the specified assemblies.

    public string GetValueTypeName (System.Reflection.AssemblyName[] names);

    Parameters

    • names
      AssemblyName[]

      The assemblies to examine for the type.

    Returns

    • String

      A string that represents the fully qualified name of the type.

    Exceptions

    • TypeLoadException

      The corresponding type could not be found.

Explicit Interface Implementations

  • ISerializable.GetObjectData(SerializationInfo,StreamingContext)

    Populates a SerializationInfo object with the data needed to serialize the target object.

    void ISerializable.GetObjectData (System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo si, System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext context);

    Parameters

    • si
      SerializationInfo

      An object to populate with data.

    • context
      StreamingContext

      The destination for this serialization.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the ResXDataNode instance is cast to an ISerializable interface.
